source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.employee_fact)
- **New Data:** where a Pers_No in the source does not exist as an EmployeeNumber in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Pers_No in source and EmployeeNumber in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'

## View employee_fact_new is created

%%sql
-- Build Employee_fact table -- merge

-- Notes - Addresses are only supplied for Inspectors - need to check inspector count against addresses data


CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW employee_fact_new 

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash and flags as "NewData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    T1.Pers_No as EmployeeID,
    to_date(T1.Birth_date) as DOB,
    T1.NI_number as NINumber,
    T1.Pers_No as PersNumber,
    T2.Staff_Number as EmployeeNumber,
    T1.Employee_No as LegacyEmployeeNumber,
    NULL as NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
    T4.SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from) AS IngestionDate,
    NULL as ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Birth_date,'.'), IFNULL(T1.NI_number, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Pers_No, '.'),IFNULL(T2.Staff_Number, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Employee_No,'.'))) as RowID, 
    'Y' as IsActive, 
    T7.IsActive as HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr T1
LEFT JOIN odw_standardised_db.vw_addresses T2 ON T1.Pers_No = T2.Staff_Number
LEFT JOIN odw_standardised_db.vw_email T3 ON T1.Pers_No = T3.Staff_Number
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T4 ON "SAP HR" = T4.Description and T4.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN ( SELECT staff_number, max(ded_from) as AnnualLeaveStartDate
            FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_leave
            GRoup BY Staff_Number) T5 ON T1.Pers_No = T5.staff_number    
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact T7 ON T1.Pers_No = T7.PersNumber AND T7.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
        -- flags new data        
        CASE
            WHEN T1.Pers_No = T7.PersNumber AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Birth_date,'.'), IFNULL(T1.NI_number, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Pers_No, '.'),IFNULL(T2.Staff_Number, '.'), IFNULL(T1.Employee_No,'.')))  <> T7.RowID     
            THEN 'Y'
            WHEN T7.PersNumber IS NULL
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END  = 'Y' 
AND T1.Pers_No IS NOT NULL;

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **employee_fact_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View employee_fact_changed_rows is created

%%sql

-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY  VIEW employee_fact_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated and new rows 

Select 
    EmployeeID, -- surrogate key
    DOB,
    NINumber,
    PersNumber,
    EmployeeNumber,
    LegacyEmployeeNumber,
    NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From employee_fact_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    EmployeeID, -- surrogate key
    DOB,
    NINumber,
    PersNumber,
    EmployeeNumber,
    LegacyEmployeeNumber,
    NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact
WHERE PersNumber IN (SELECT PersNumber FROM employee_fact_new WHERE RowID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM employee_fact_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW employee_fact_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    T1.EmployeeID,
    DOB,
    NINumber,
    PersNumber,
    EmployeeNumber,
    LegacyEmployeeNumber,
    NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM employee_fact_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View employee_fact_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. Pers_No from SAP HR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.employee_fact is updated

%%sql
-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact AS Target
USING employee_fact_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.EmployeeID = Target.EmployeeID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'
        
-- Insert completely new rows
-- WHEN NOT MATCHED 
--     THEN INSERT (EmployeeID,
--         DOB,
--         NINumber,
--         PersNumber,
--         EmployeeNumber,
--         LegacyEmployeeNumber,
--         NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
--         SourceSystemID,
--         IngestionDate,
--         ValidTo,
--         RowID,
--         IsActive)  
--         VALUES (Source.EmployeeID,
--         Source.DOB,
--         Source.NINumber,
--         Source.PersNumber,
--         Source.EmployeeNumber,
--         Source.LegacyEmployeeNumber,
--         Source.NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
--         Source.SourceSystemID, 
--         Source.IngestionDate, 
--         Source.ValidTo, 
--         Source.RowID, 
--         Source.IsActive)  ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.employee_fact is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new employee_fact

INSERT INTO odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact

SELECT 
    EmployeeID, 
    DOB,
    NINumber,
    PersNumber,
    EmployeeNumber,
    LegacyEmployeeNumber,
    NewSAPEmployeeNumber,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM employee_fact_changed_rows;
